reviews.name: HeatMax HotHands Hand Warmers, 40 pairs
reviews.reviewText: Seen a question on how many pairs per case. I just ordered some and there are 40 pairs per case.
reviews.title: Pairs per case

reviews.name: HeatMax HotHands Hand Warmers, 40 pairs
reviews.reviewText: I used them yesterday, for the first time, up at the lake and they worked great. 20 degrees and frost with thin sportsmens gloves(3 fingertips missing on each hand) on and my hands stayed warm. Not too big, and they last a long time. Going to keep a couple packs in my tackel box......and PARENTS..... My 2 year old thought they were NOT to warm to touch...and NO i didn't take her fishing that morning! Might help keep kids warm if you enjoy plaing in snow.
reviews.title: WORKS GREAT!!!

reviews.name: HeatMax HotHands Hand Warmers, 40 pairs
reviews.reviewText: By Box I mean Freezer. I operate a forklift in a Freezer Warehouse, which is 5 below zero. I use these inside of mittens to keep my fingers warm. They do a good job keeping them warm for about the 9-10 hours. Some seem to get a little hotter than others but they still do the job. The bulk box has 40 sets of hand warmers. Each warmer is approx. 2" X 3" in size.
reviews.title: Good for the Box

reviews.name: HeatMax HotHands Hand Warmers, 40 pairs
reviews.reviewText: You can save this product after using it for a couple of hours by sealing it in a zip type bag and using it again the next day. This product does not get to hot but does offer comfort on temps around the 20's.
reviews.title: A nice hand warmer

reviews.name: HeatMax HotHands Hand Warmers, 40 pairs
reviews.reviewText: I have used this particular item for years with a great degree of satisfacton.
reviews.title: 09 October 2010
